description: From pentecost +‎ -er, from Medieval Latin pentēcostē, from Ancient Greek πεντηκοστή (pentēkostḗ, “fiftieth”). Cognate with Pentecost.

entries.meaning: An officer who commands fifty men, particularly (historical) in the Spartan army.
examples: ...they would have the command of the pentecoster, penteconter, or pentecoptater (for thus variously the title is written)...
